ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
antic:
- '0.2'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
gmp:
- '6'
libboost_devel:
- '1.88'
libboost_headers:
- '1.88'
libeantic:
- '2'
libflint:
- '3.0'
- '3.1'
- '3.2'
- '3.3'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
- 3.11.* *_cpython
- 3.12.* *_cpython
- 3.13.* *_cp313
- 3.14.* *_cp314
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
e-antic is a C/C++/Python library to deal with real embedded number fields
built on top of ANTIC. It aims to provide the fastest possible exact
arithmetic operations and comparisons.

built on top of ANTIC. It aims to provide the fastest possible exact
arithmetic operations and comparisons.

built on top of ANTIC. It aims to provide the fastest possible exact

name: e-antic

about.description:
e-antic is a C/C++/Python library to deal with real embedded number fields
built on top of ANTIC. It aims to provide the fastest possible exact
arithmetic operations and comparisons.

e-antic is a C/C++/Python library to deal with real embedded number fields
built on top of ANTIC. It aims to provide the fastest possible exact
arithmetic operations and comparisons.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "e-antic" %}
{% set version = "2.1.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/flatsurf/e-antic/releases/download/{{ version }}/e-antic-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e3e78701d054b441f95d83b6fb55cd84bfd931f5d4a61a2822dc977a20c46f80

build:
  number: 3
  # Upstream doesn't support MSVC yet.
  skip: true  # [win]

outputs:
  - name: libeantic
    script: build-libeantic.sh
    run_exports:
      # e-antic uses semantic versioning https://github.com/videlec/e-antic/issues/12
      - {{ pin_subpackage("libeantic") }}
    requirements:
      build:
        - libtool   # [unix]
        - automake  # [unix]
        - make      # [unix]
        - autotools_clang_conda  # [win]
        - gnuconfig  # [unix]
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
      host:
        # We only need the libboost-headers at compile time. However, since we
        # use bits of boost in our API, code built against libeantic must be
        # built with a compatible version of the headers. Therefore, we add a
        # liboost pin to our run exports so libboost-headers are going to be
        # in a compatible version.
        - libboost-devel
        - gmp       # [unix]
        - mpir      # [win]
        - libflint
        - antic  # [libflint == '2.9']
        - arb    # [libflint == '2.9']
    test:
      commands:
        - test -f $PREFIX/include/e-antic/e-antic.h  # [linux or osx]
        - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libeantic.so           # [linux]
        - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libeanticxx.so         # [linux]
        - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libeantic.dylib        # [osx]
        - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libeanticxx.dylib      # [osx]

  - name: pyeantic
    script: build-pyeantic.sh
    build:
      # cppyy is not available on ppc64le
      skip: true  # [ppc64le]
      # cppyy is not available on aarch64
      skip: true  # [aarch64]
      ignore_run_exports_from:
        - icu *
    requirements:
      build:
        - python                              # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - libtool   # [unix]
        - automake  # [unix]
        - make      # [unix]
        - autotools_clang_conda  # [win]
        - gnuconfig  # [unix]
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        # Strangely, the C compiler is not functional on macOS when
        # cross-compiling here when this library is not installed.
        # We get:
        # dyld[28667]: Library not loaded: @rpath/libtapi.dylib
        #   Referenced from: <B7360C67-C20A-35AE-922B-D9A6315483FE> /Users/runner/miniforge3/pkgs/ld64_osx-arm64-951.9-hb820725_3/bin/arm64-apple-darwin20.0.0-ld
        # which does not seem to have anything to do with expat.
        - libexpat
      host:
        # Note that the libboost-devel from libeantic forces these headers to be
        # compatible with ones used when building libeantic.
        - libboost-headers
        - python
        - cppyy
        - cppyythonizations
        - gmpxxyy
        - setuptools
        - pytest
        - {{ pin_subpackage("libeantic") }}
        # See https://github.com/conda-forge/libxml2-feedstock/issues/137
        # and https://github.com/conda/conda-build/issues/3308
        - icu *
      run:
        - python
        - cppyy
        - cppyythonizations
        - gmpxxyy
        # cppyy dynamically compiles C++ wrappers at runtime, therefore we need C++ headers of boost.
        # Note that the libboost-devel from libeantic forces these headers to be
        # compatible with ones used when building libeantic.
        - libboost-headers
        # A subpackage does not see the run_exports of another subpackage:
        # https://github.com/conda/conda-build/issues/3478
        - {{ pin_subpackage("libeantic") }}
    test:
      imports:
        - pyeantic

about:
  home: https://github.com/flatsurf/e-antic
  license: LGPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file:
    - COPYING
    - COPYING.LESSER
  summary: embedded algebraic number fields
  description: |
    e-antic is a C/C++/Python library to deal with real embedded number fields
    built on top of ANTIC. It aims to provide the fastest possible exact
    arithmetic operations and comparisons.
  dev_url: https://github.com/flatsurf/e-antic

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - saraedum
    - videlec
